body: It was designed so. `environment-to-ini` only adds/updates, never deletes.
@wxiaoguang This is not about deletes, but is about "adds".

Try to run environment-to-ini with e.g.

```
GITEA__log_0X2E_router__MODE=console
GITEA__log_0X2E_xorm__MODE=console
```

These values will not be added to `app.ini` if the `[log]` has `MODE` already set to `console` in the `app.ini` file.
I have added a failing test to demonstrate the issue: https://github.com/n9/gitea/commit/c70896126ac82c4c94eaaf7a3a2a2f76b1a18513

It's the legacy/unmaintained INI package's bug (or quirk behavior).

The section values are inherited. So `[sec].key=SOME` also means  `[sec.sub].key=SOME`

Yes, but this does not work in `loadLogModeByName` and fails here:

https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/4126aad4aa12f3dbd4a21063d266d096ee6bb52f/modules/setting/log.go#L168

As mode is resolved using `ConfigSectionKeyString`:

https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/4126aad4aa12f3dbd4a21063d266d096ee6bb52f/modules/setting/log.go#L116

which calls `ConfigSectionString` that is not using inheritance:

https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/4126aad4aa12f3dbd4a21063d266d096ee6bb52f/modules/setting/config_provider.go#L118-L130

issue.title: Fix `environment-to-ini` inherited key bug

repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body:
Fix  #27541

The INI package has a quirk: by default, the keys are inherited.
When maintaining the keys, the newly added sub key should not be affected by the parent key.

body:
Thank you for your detailed report.

I think the fix could be this:  Fix environment-to-ini inherited key bug #27543

issue.body:
Backport #27543 by @wxiaoguang

Fix  #27541

The INI package has a quirk: by default, the keys are inherited.
When maintaining the keys, the newly added sub key should not be affected by the parent key.
